name: drymocallis arguta
description: Ranging from 1-3 feet tall, Drymocallis arguta (Prairie Cinquefoil) features crowded rosettes of attractive cream to light yellow flowers and prefers medium to dry soil. Synonyms include Potentilla arguta and Tall Cinquefoil.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
